attributes.action: Stop the proposed Westley Green development from gaining planning permission
attributes.additional_details: The increase in traffic and proposed metro link would be detrimental to the wildlife, regardless of the efforts to make this a 'green' town. Many of us, having lived here for decades, would feel pushed out of our homes as it would not be the place we loved and recognised anymore.
attributes.background: A new garden city is proposed at Six Mile Bottom, Cambridgeshire and the surrounding area. 8,500 new houses would be built on 1,350 acres of farmland. We do not want our village to be developed into a town, we chose to live in a quiet rural area, with thriving wildlife and historical buildings.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Planning decisions are the responsibility of local councils.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
